author: protolambda
content: Optimizations are welcome, but you should chat with <@550420431744794624> or <@862973562243252234> about the current state of BLST bindings development. The cgo overhead is indeed a bottleneck for integration into go-kzg, but there's a chance the BLST authors integrate the necessary KZG functions into their library, so the call overhead is reduced a lot (from 1000s of calls to just a handful). That said, I dislike CGO in general, so research into alternatives is great too.

author: protolambda
content: And we're going to use a verification optimization that reduces the verification cost by 10x or so, see https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/2915

author: potuz
content: Adding KZG to BLST is not too much effort but it's not clear to me that there would be any substantial gain over just writing the right bindings and using go-kzg or so. Porting BLST to goassembly would be a clear winner at least to Prysm and Geth but that's a large project and already porting hashtree was a pain in the butt
